sentence1: "NOW, my dears," said old Mrs. Rabbit one morning, "you may go into the fields or down the lane, but don't go into Mr. McGregor's garden: your Father had an accident there;
sentence2: THEN old Mrs. Rabbit took a basket and her umbrella, to the baker's.

sentence1: THEN old Mrs. Rabbit took a basket and her umbrella, to the baker's.
sentence2: She bought a loaf of brown bread and five currant buns.

sentence1: She bought a loaf of brown bread and five currant buns.
sentence2: FLOPSY, Mopsy, and Cottontail, who were good little bunnies, went down the lane to gather blackberries;

sentence1: FLOPSY, Mopsy, and Cottontail, who were good little bunnies, went down the lane to gather blackberries;
sentence2: BUT Peter, who was very naughty, ran straight away to Mr. McGregor's garden and squeezed under the gate!

sentence1: BUT Peter, who was very naughty, ran straight away to Mr. McGregor's garden and squeezed under the gate!
sentence2: FIRST he ate some lettuces and some French beans;

sentence1: FIRST he ate some lettuces and some French beans;
sentence2: and then he ate some radishes;

sentence1: and then he ate some radishes;
sentence2: AND then, feeling rather sick, he went to look for some parsley.

sentence1: AND then, feeling rather sick, he went to look for some parsley.
sentence2: BUT round the end of a cucumber frame, whom should he meet but Mr. McGregor!

sentence1: BUT round the end of a cucumber frame, whom should he meet but Mr. McGregor!
sentence2: MR. McGREGOR was on his hands and knees planting out young cabbages, but he jumped up and ran after Peter, waving a rake and calling out, "Stop thief!"

sentence1: MR. McGREGOR was on his hands and knees planting out young cabbages, but he jumped up and ran after Peter, waving a rake and calling out, "Stop thief!"
sentence2: he rushed all over the garden, for he had forgotten the way back to the gate.

sentence1: he rushed all over the garden, for he had forgotten the way back to the gate.
sentence2: He lost one of his shoes among the cabbages, and the other shoe amongst the potatoes.

sentence1: He lost one of his shoes among the cabbages, and the other shoe amongst the potatoes.
sentence2: AFTER losing them, he ran on four legs and went faster, so that I think he might have got away altogether if he had not unfortunately run into a gooseberry net, and got caught by the large buttons on his jacket.

sentence1: AFTER losing them, he ran on four legs and went faster, so that I think he might have got away altogether if he had not unfortunately run into a gooseberry net, and got caught by the large buttons on his jacket.
sentence2: PETER gave himself up for lost, and shed big tears;

sentence1: PETER gave himself up for lost, and shed big tears;
sentence2: but his sobs were overheard by some friendly sparrows, who flew to him in great excitement, and implored him to exert himself.

sentence1: but his sobs were overheard by some friendly sparrows, who flew to him in great excitement, and implored him to exert himself.
sentence2: MR. McGREGOR came up with a sieve, which he intended to pop upon the top of Peter;

sentence1: MR. McGREGOR came up with a sieve, which he intended to pop upon the top of Peter;
sentence2: but Peter wriggled out just in time, leaving his jacket behind him.

sentence1: but Peter wriggled out just in time, leaving his jacket behind him.
sentence2: He began to turn them over carefully, looking under each.

sentence1: He began to turn them over carefully, looking under each.
sentence2: Mr. McGregor was after him in no time, AND tried to put his foot upon Peter, who jumped out of a window, upsetting three plants.

sentence1: Mr. McGregor was after him in no time, AND tried to put his foot upon Peter, who jumped out of a window, upsetting three plants.
sentence2: The window was too small for Mr. McGregor, and he was tired of running after Peter.

sentence1: The window was too small for Mr. McGregor, and he was tired of running after Peter.
sentence2: PETER sat down to rest;

sentence1: PETER sat down to rest;
sentence2: he was out of breath and trembling with fright, and he had not the least idea which way to go.

sentence1: he was out of breath and trembling with fright, and he had not the least idea which way to go.
sentence2: After a time he began to wander about, going lippity--lippity--not very fast, and looking all around.

sentence1: After a time he began to wander about, going lippity--lippity--not very fast, and looking all around.
sentence2: HE found a door in a wall;

sentence1: HE found a door in a wall;
sentence2: An old mouse was running in and out over the stone doorstep, carrying peas and beans to her family in the wood.

sentence1: An old mouse was running in and out over the stone doorstep, carrying peas and beans to her family in the wood.
sentence2: Peter asked her the way to the gate, but she had such a large pea in her mouth that she could not answer.

sentence1: Peter asked her the way to the gate, but she had such a large pea in her mouth that she could not answer.
sentence2: She only shook her head at him.

sentence1: She only shook her head at him.
sentence2: Peter began to cry.

sentence1: Peter began to cry.
sentence2: THEN he tried to find his way straight across the garden, but he became more and more puzzled.

sentence1: THEN he tried to find his way straight across the garden, but he became more and more puzzled.
sentence2: Presently, he came to a pond where Mr. McGregor filled his water-cans.

sentence1: Presently, he came to a pond where Mr. McGregor filled his water-cans.
sentence2: Peter thought it best to go away without speaking to her;

sentence1: Peter thought it best to go away without speaking to her;
sentence2: he had heard about cats from his cousin, little Benjamin Bunny.

sentence1: he had heard about cats from his cousin, little Benjamin Bunny.
sentence2: HE went back towards the tool-shed, but suddenly, quite close to him, he heard the noise of a hoe--scr-r-ritch, scratch, scratch, scritch.

sentence1: HE went back towards the tool-shed, but suddenly, quite close to him, he heard the noise of a hoe--scr-r-ritch, scratch, scratch, scritch.
sentence2: Peter scuttered underneath the bushes.

sentence1: Peter scuttered underneath the bushes.
sentence2: But presently, as nothing happened, he came out, and climbed upon a wheelbarrow, and peeped over.

sentence1: But presently, as nothing happened, he came out, and climbed upon a wheelbarrow, and peeped over.
sentence2: The first thing he saw was Mr. McGregor hoeing onions.

sentence1: The first thing he saw was Mr. McGregor hoeing onions.
sentence2: His back was turned towards Peter, and beyond him was the gate!

sentence1: His back was turned towards Peter, and beyond him was the gate!
sentence2: PETER got down very quietly off the wheelbarrow, and started running as fast as he could go, along a straight walk behind some black-currant bushes.

sentence1: PETER got down very quietly off the wheelbarrow, and started running as fast as he could go, along a straight walk behind some black-currant bushes.
sentence2: Mr. McGregor caught sight of him at the corner, but Peter did not care.

sentence1: Mr. McGregor caught sight of him at the corner, but Peter did not care.
sentence2: He slipped underneath the gate, and was safe at last in the wood outside the garden.

sentence1: He slipped underneath the gate, and was safe at last in the wood outside the garden.
sentence2: PETER never stopped running or looked behind him till he got home to the big fir-tree.

sentence1: PETER never stopped running or looked behind him till he got home to the big fir-tree.
sentence2: He was so tired that he flopped down upon the nice soft sand on the floor of the rabbit-hole, and shut his eyes.

sentence1: He was so tired that he flopped down upon the nice soft sand on the floor of the rabbit-hole, and shut his eyes.
sentence2: His mother was busy cooking;

sentence1: His mother was busy cooking;
sentence2: she wondered what he had done with his clothes.

sentence1: she wondered what he had done with his clothes.
sentence2: It was the second little jacket and pair of shoes that Peter had lost in a fortnight!

sentence1: It was the second little jacket and pair of shoes that Peter had lost in a fortnight!
sentence2: I AM sorry to say that Peter was not very well during the evening.

sentence1: I AM sorry to say that Peter was not very well during the evening.
sentence2: His mother put him to bed, and made some camomile tea;

sentence1: His mother put him to bed, and made some camomile tea;
sentence2: and she gave a dose of it to Peter!

sentence1: and she gave a dose of it to Peter!
sentence2: BUT Flopsy, Mopsy, and Cotton-tail had bread and milk and blackberries, for supper.
